Article.Heading: White House Defends Spying On You
Article.Content: The White House on Thursday defended the National Security Agency's need to collect telephone records of U.S. citizens, calling such information "a critical tool in protecting the nation from terrorist threats.

Article.Heading: Man Tries To Commit Suicide Outside The 'Today Show'
Article.Content: A man in a crowd gathered at Rockefeller Plaza to watch 'The Today Show' tried to kill himself by cutting his wrists Wednesday morning, police said.

Article.Heading: How To Look Smart And Be Smart
Article.Content: Nobody ever said looking good had to be expensive. And if they did, they're liars.

Article.Heading: Here's Why Google Reader Really Got The Axe
Article.Content: There’s another reason Google decided to put its RSS reader to death.

Article.Heading: This Is Data, The World's First Comedy Bot
Article.Content: They're drone-striking Afghanistan for us. They're replacing us on the assembly line at the Hostess plant. They're even cutting into our aortas during life-or-death surgery. But can robots master one of the most mysterious—and quintessentially human—skills of them all: making people laugh

Article.Heading: George R. R. Martin Watches 'Red Wedding' Reaction Videos
Article.Content: How does the "Game of Thrones" author react to fan freakouts? With chuckling delight.
